alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 2:27PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Navajo County near Show Low through 300 PM MST... At 226 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Show Low, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Localized flooding is possible. Locations impacted include... Show Low, Pinetop-lakeside, Taylor, Shumway, Wagon Wheel, Lake Of The Woods--Pinetop-lakeside, Linden, Pinedale, Snowflake, Lakeside Campground, Scott Reservoir Campground, Fool Hollow Lake Campground, White Mountain Lake and Lewis Canyon Group Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 277 near mile marker 335. State Route 260 between mile markers 324 and 354. State Route 77 between mile markers 343 and 360. Highway 60 between mile markers 331 and 349. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; White Mountains
